Sign In

sign up for our beta

monitoring is broken. raintank is fixing it.

  • the vision
  • the team
  • work with us
  • open source

It's gotten complicated, frustrating and expensive.

It's become a massive hallucination. People get bombarded with confusing alerts, so they can stare at nonsensical charts while half awake, just to see if a problem even exists.

data deluge Traffic's way up, but so is the amount of metrics, messages and alerts from your ever-growing stack.

terrible choices A proprietary solution? SaaS? It'll be expensive, and you'll lose control. Open source? Could be a time sink.

fractured vision You want correlation and collaboration, across your whole stack. Disparate tools and data make seeing the whole picture hard.

It doesn't have to be so bad.



raintank is fixing it.

an opensaas monitoring engine

We believe all infrastructure platform software is destined to be open source. Our OpenSaaS platform combines the turnkey and scalable nature of a SaaS offering, with all of the advantages of open source software. Run raintank in the cloud, in your datacenter, or as a hybrid deployment. Take back control of your data and destiny, and eliminate lock­-in.

that's gorgeously powerful,

Leveraging Grafana, the leading open source metrics dashboard, we are building a gorgeously powerful frontend that allows you to view, distill and share clear insights about your infrastructure. Grafana2 will plug into raintank to provide a beautiful and seamless experience that democratizes monitoring. Who said open source wasn't sexy?

and unifies data and understanding.

Already have Graphite? OpenTSDB? InfluxDB? Connect it to the platform, whether that data is on-premise or in the cloud. Add tons of capabilities around these existing databases, and get a unified view of what's going on. Users, networks, applications, instances, devices and zones: we look at all horizons of your stack. This broad view allows for unprecedented context and situational awareness.

sound interesting? we'd love to chat.

contact us

sign up for our beta

everything we do is open source. period.

  • the vision
  • the team
  • work with us
  • open source

it’s not about political beliefs. it’s not about cutting costs. it’s not because it’s the cool thing to do.

Simply put, we believe that open source is the best way to develop the most awesome software for our customers. We also think that all infrastructure software is destined to be open.

Our mission is to provide a fully supported, turnkey offering for our customers through our OpenSaaS platform. We want to help them avoid lock in, and take back control: hopefully a refreshing change in a world filled with proprietary SaaS options.

Everything we do is open-source. It’s better for our customers. Better for our employees. Better for the community.

Don’t take our word for it, check out the code:

download grafana


download litmus

what are you waiting for?

  • the vision
  • the team
  • work with us
  • open source

we’re always looking for awesome people to join us on our adventure.

open source

Build the future with us, and ship code. Everything we do is completely open source.

ground floor

We're a small team, with small-seed funding. We control our destiny; the team owns raintank.

global mindset

Founders on three continents, servers in more. Work from wherever you want. We're post-geographical.

happy/healthy

Mind and body. Real work-life balance. Take unlimited vacation. Get great healthcare.

the nicest toys

Mac? PC? SGI circa 1999? Choose the right tools to do your job, and we'll get them to you.

sound crazy?

Sounds good. Help build a new type of platform, and a new kind of company. Let's talk.

we're always on the lookout for new talent.

a little bit about the team.

  • the vision
  • the team
  • work with us
  • open source

our opinions are forged from experience. find out what makes us tick.

raj dutt

co-founder/ceo

Raj was the Founder and CEO of Voxel, ­a cloud and hosting company which was purchased by Internap in 2012, where he spent 2 years as SVP of Technology. He likes to fly airplanes, and is currently in the middle of a motor­glider license.

  • Twitter
  • LinkedIn

torkel ödegaard

co-founder/cgo

Torkel is the creator of Grafana, the open source metrics dashboard that raintank is built around. He enjoys seeing people use metrics more through beautiful and easy to use software. Torkel is infatuated with the theory of evolution.

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn

anthony woods

co-founder/cto

Anthony Woods ran Operations for Voxel in Singapore, and has also worked on the tooling that keeps Visa's payment systems running. Anthony enjoys drinking large amounts of beer, and using Singapore as a hub for traveling Asia.

  • Github
  • LinkedIn

matt toback

vp, customer experience

Matt started his career as CFO of a global managed hosting provider, Voxel dot Net. From inception in 1999, he managed the financial operations through years of double-digit growth. Following a successful capital raise, he focused on product design, development and revenue growth as CEO of Ubersmith, a wholly owned subsidiary. As a result of a successful exit to Internap (NASDAQ: INAP), he created a new team of designers and developers to refresh the Internap customer facing tools & creative collateral.

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn

trent white

vp, marketing and design

Trent began in higher-ed as a web developer, art director and adjunct faculty of design. Upon moving to New York in 2010, he became art director at Equinox, a global luxury lifestyle and fitness company where he conceived ads and multi-channel marketing campaigns. Most recently at Internap, Trent led creative initiatives and worked with designers, developers and marketing professionals to reimagine the brand from the ground up.

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn

dieter plaetinck

principal engineer

Dieter operated large scale systems at Netlog and built out backends at Vimeo. He blogs about next-gen monitoring tactics and started projects such as metrics 2.0 and Graph-Explorer. He now teamed up with raintank to maximize his impact, while traveling the world as a nomadic programmer.

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn

jeremy bingham

senior developer

Jeremy Bingham did devs and ops at Daily Kos for over a decade. Now he’s doing a similar sort of thing at Raintank. He likes working with Go, listens to opera, does amateur astronomy stuff as an extracurricular activity, and knows that Tacoma is nicer than you think.

  • Twitter
  • Github
  • LinkedIn

Sign In

sign up for our beta

raintank is an open source platform that collects, stores, and analyzes data from your entire infrastructure stack.

greetings GopherCon 2015 attendee.

thanks for your interest in raintank.

Raintank is building a next-generation monitoring platform that's 100% open source. Litmus is our first integration, which is focused on network performance monitoring. Litmus monitors your web app performance and uptime, over the Internet and/or your internal network, so that you can make your users happier.

Built on Grafana, we have created a gorgeously powerful, fully open platform to allow you to track and troubleshoot your application performance and availability


You can learn more about Litmus and raintank on our main website.



we could talk about raintank all day, but why not just try out our free beta?

Give us a domain name and 60 seconds — we’ll monitor it from all over the world, at high-resolution, for free.

Litmus, our first integration, and is a great way to get started with Grafana. Monitor the data quality of any web app from anywhere. Get a handle on your application performance and availability from all over the world. Keep your users happy by finding and fixing problems fast.

the power of grafana

Built on Grafana, Litmus is much more than just vanilla NPM. Use the power of Grafana to bring in your other data sources, and leverage its leading visualization capabilities to create the perfect view that brings it all together.

Download Grafana »

60 second setup

Give us a domain name, and we’ll give you insights in less than a minute. Litmus automatically suggests what to monitor. There’s no software or agents to install or configure.


Get Started »

a personalized footprint

Monitor from dozens of Litmus locations across the world. Install our open source Collector software to monitor from the locations that are important to you, including your own datacenter and branch offices.

Learn About Litmus »

stay up to date on new releases

the world's leading open source graph and dashboard composer for visualizing measurement data.

Gorgeously Powerful. Infinitely extensible. A vibrant community.

It’s no wonder that Grafana is the worlds most popular open source visualization software for measurement data.

We’re thrilled to be the company behind Grafana, and we’re here to make sure your Grafana projects and implementations are successful. Commercial support for both hosted and on-premise Grafana is coming soon.



But don’t take our word for it, download Grafana and see for yourself.

ridiculously easy network performance monitoring

Litmus is our first integration, and is a great way to get started with Grafana. Monitor the data quality of any web app from anywhere. Get a handle on your application performance and availability from all over the world. Keep your users happy by finding and fixing problems fast.

sign up in 60 seconds free

Give us a domain name, and we’ll give you insights in less than a minute. Litmus automatically suggests what to monitor. There’s no software or agents to install or configure.


a personalized footprint

Monitor from dozens of Litmus locations across the world. Install our open source Collector software to monitor from the locations that are important to you, including your own datacenter and branch offices.

Learn About Litmus »

a picture that’s right for you

Raintank is behind and built on top of Grafana, the world's leading open source visualization software for measurement data. Bring in your other data sources and use its leading capabilities to create that perfect view.

collaborate with anyone

Litmus makes it easy to share your data with your team, partners, or the web. Take a snapshot for sharing it with anyone, giving them access to just the data that you want.

100% open source

Litmus is 100% open-source, and also available as a fully supported SaaS and on-premise offering from raintank. Take back control of your data destiny, and avoid lock-in. You always own the raw data.

bring all your data together

Litmus is 100% open-source, and also available as a fully supported SaaS and on-premise offering from raintank. Take back control of your data destiny, and avoid lock-in. You always own the raw data.

understand your global performance

Litmus, our first integration allows you to monitor the data quality of any web app from all over the world, even inside your own datacenter. Keep your users happy by finding and fixing problems fast.

sound good? sign up for our free beta.

Sign In

sign up for our beta

ridiculously easy network performance monitoring

  • what is litmus?
  • use cases
  • road map
  • faq

frequently asked questions.

I still don’t get it. Can you give me an example?

Let’s say you run an e-commerce application. You can use Litmus to get a real-time view of its performance and availability. As often as every 10 seconds, Litmus will test your application from dozens of Collectors around the world in the markets that are important to you. Litmus will alert you in real-time if there are any outages or slow-downs, and help you keep track of your performance, and even compare them to your competitors. When you have a problem, Litmus will send you a high quality and speedy alert. It also helps triage by pinpointing the problem to a particular region or part of your stack. It does all of this via external probes; you don’t have to install or configure any software or agents.

Which protocols does Litmus support?

Litmus can test, store, visualize, and alert on the following protocols about your endpoint:

  • Ping uptime and performance (eg. latency, loss, jitter)
  • DNS uptime and performance (eg. latency, responses)
  • HTTP(s) uptime and performance
You can configure each endpoint to your exact needs, but we will autosuggest protocols based on what we can probe.

Is Litmus open-source?

Absolutely. Everything we do at raintank is open-source. Litmus is provided under a permissive Apache license, just like Grafana. You can run it on-premise, or in the cloud as an OpenSaaS service that is fully supported by raintank. We believe all infrastructure software is destined to be open-source. Litmus allows you to avoid lock-in and take back control of your data destiny.

Why should I use Litmus? How is it different?

The network performance monitoring space is certainly crowded. There are a wealth of players from the low-end (eg. Pingdom) to the high-end (eg. Catchpoint, ThousandEyes). Litmus is our vision of how NPM should be done, but we believe it’s more important to get a “big picture” of your infrastructure that brings information from different parts of your stack together. Since Litmus is built on top of Grafana, you can add your existing data sources and visualize and alert on your existing data side-by-side with Litmus. It’s a great way to easily get started with Grafana. Raintank will be announcing additional integrations that will bring in other parts of your stack together under a common platform. You can test your application as often as every 10 seconds from dozens of Collectors around the world. This means you can catch micro-outages that might not otherwise show up, be alerted much faster, and troubleshoot in real-time. This kind of resolution and metric volume would normally cost hundreds or even thousands of dollars per month with other providers.

Why is Litmus free?

We’re building the raintank OpenSaaS platform, and Litmus is the first step in that journey. We want to create a world class metrics-as-a-service platform that brings data about your entire stack together. Litmus is currently in beta and is helping us stress-test that platform. We need your help to get us to a final release. Your suggestions and feedback are invaluable, so we’ve decided to make Litmus free (with some reasonable limits) during the beta.

I want to add a large amount of Endpoints or Collectors. Can you raise my limits?

Sure, we’d love to! Just drop us a note and we’d be happy to upgrade you and get you what you need. No charge. Our only ask is that you give us feedback.

I don’t want to use the UI. I need to automate. Do you have an API?

Of course! We have a fully featured HTTP API. Anything that you can do through the UI you can also do through the API. Many Litmus users have a central “source of truth” and our API makes it easy to integrate with.

What’s next for Litmus?

Litmus is under active development, and is being shaped by your feedback and suggestions. For more information, check out our roadmap

ridiculously easy network performance monitoring

  • what is litmus?
  • use cases
  • road map
  • faq

litmus continually monitors your apps performance and uptime, from all over the world, so you can make sure your users stay happy.

Litmus monitors your web app performance and uptime, over the Internet and/or your internal network, so that you can make your users happier.

Built on Grafana, we have created a gorgeously powerful, fully open platform to allow you to track and troubleshoot your application performance and availability

pinpoint the problem quickly

Is the problem a regional network issue? DNS, yet again? A slowdown in the backend?

Litmus allows you to pinpoint the problem through gorgeous visualizations, giving you context across different layers of the stack.

a global footprint you make your own

Monitor performance from all over the planet, across different networks and carriers with dozens of public Litmus collectors.

Install our open-source Collector software to measure the performance of/from your own datacenters and offices, and customize your footprint.

ridiculously easy

There’s no software or agent to install or configure. Be up and running with Litmus and Grafana in less than 60 seconds.

Just give us the domain name of your site or application, and we’ll automatically detect what to monitor.

reduce the noise

Litmus provides a clean backbone signal from around the world, and automatically learns what “normal” is so that you don’t have to.

RAINDEX, our dynamically computed index of performance from every Collector make your alerts even even cleaner and more actionable.

get alerted

Sit back and relax, we’ll let you know when you experience a problem, and won’t annoy you with false positives.

a global footprint you make your own

Monitor performance from all over the planet, across different networks and carriers with dozens of public Litmus collectors.

Install our open-source Collector software to measure the performance of/from your own datacenters and offices, and customize your footprint.

we could talk about litmus all day, why not try it yourself

ridiculously easy to get started

There’s no software or agent to install or configure. Be up and running with Litmus and Grafana in less than 60 seconds.

Just give us the domain name of your site or application, and we’ll automatically detect what to monitor.

the power of grafana

Built on Grafana, Litmus is much more than just vanilla NPM. Use the power of Grafana to bring in your other data sources, and leverage its leading visualization capabilities to create the perfect view that brings it all together.

real-time insight

Litmus gives you real time insight into exactly what’s going on. With 10 second monitoring, you can watch problems as they develop and get instant feedback as soon as they’re resolved.

Sign In

ridiculously easy network performance monitoring

  • what is litmus?
  • use cases
  • road map
  • faq

what’s coming down the pipe?

Litmus is currently in alpha. We have a lot on our backlogs, but here are some of the things we’re focusing on that we’re particularly excited about.


1. Synthetic browser

We will be revamping the HTTP and HTTPS checks to optionally use a synthetic browser. This will provide much more relevant and interesting data, including Javascript execution time and third party dependencies. We are also looking at integrating sitespeed.io to provide performance best practices.

2. Real User Monitoring

Litmus is great for providing a noise-free signal from backbone locations around the world. But what about real users on actual last mile or mobile networks? Litmus will soon measure response times from customers actual browsers and networks, allowing for a complimentary perspective.

3. Alerting

The beta release of Litmus brings a proof of concept alerting engine within Grafana that is powered by Bosun and currently purpose built for the Litmus use-case. Currently, alerting is only available for downtime and not slowdowns. We plan on improving this alerting engine and bringing it into upstream Grafana.

4. Turnkey Grafana

We want to make it easier for people who have downloaded Grafana to use the data that Litmus provides. Litmus should be a way that people can get started with Grafana easily: go from zero to gorgeously data in less than a minute.



stay up to date on new releases

anyone can use litmus to gain insight into their newtwork performance

Litmus can be used by anyone wanting insight to the performance of their web apps. We thought some use cases might help you learn how to take advantage of this historical data.

devops

service providers

site owners

devops

Your users are demanding, and they expect perfect uptime and performance. It’s your job to deliver. Your infrastructure is growing more complex every day, and it’s easy to get overwhelmed with confusing alerts.

Reduce MTTR and troubleshoot more effectively

Litmus can perform global testing as often as every 10 seconds, providing you with continuous positive validation of your uptime and performance. Unlike other solutions, you can be notified within seconds of a problem with valuable context about what kind of problem you’re dealing with.

Get quick and meaningful alerts

Litmus offers clean data and advanced alerting policies to make sure that you get timely, useful and actionable notifications every time.

Share data and collaborate

Litmus allows you to easily share interactive snapshots of exactly what you see with members of your team or third parties. Even if they don’t have a login they can see what you see.

service providers

XaaS depends on managing the quality of service between you and your users around the world. Your customers count on your infrastructure being up. You have SLAs to uphold, and it’s up to you to prove to your customers that your infrastructure is up to the task.

Get a complete perspective

Litmus provides visibility by testing from the outside-in and the inside-out. Deploy our open-source Collector within your own environment and measure all your dependencies. You can even measure performance from the perspective of your clients.

Find problems before they become issues

With continuous monitoring, Litmus can alert you with actionable alerts within seconds of a problem starting. Find and fix problems before your users notice, and improve your retention and customer satisfaction.

Collaborate with your vendors and partners

Stop playing the blame game with your ISPs and internal teams. Litmus allows you to let the data speak for itself; easily share an interactive version of what you see with snapshots.

site owners

Your website is your brand. Whether you have a complex globally distributed application, or a simple blog, you need to monitor it for performance and availability. Wouldn’t you like to keep an eye on your competition and see how your site compares? What about keeping your service providers honest, and making sure they’re living up to their SLAs?

Hold your providers accountable

Is your cloud provider meeting their SLA for uptime and performance? Which new cloud provider do you choose? Which CDN is going to best? How is the performance of your new site in Asia? Litmus can help you answer all these questions, even before your first user visit.

Find out how you stack up against the competition

Are you slowing down? Is your competition speeding up? Litmus allows you to get a handle on relative performance of your site and your competitors from the locations that matter to you.

Protect your brand

Downtime and sluggish performance is a direct hit to your brand. Litmus can send you extremely timely, high quality alerts so that you can take action immediately.
